title: Trade deficit rising due to oil buy, need to address it: EAM in Russia
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar, during his Moscow visit, proposed measures to balance the $58.9 billion trade deficit caused by increased Indian oil imports from Russia. These include addressing trade barriers, improving logistics, and finalizing the India-Eurasian Economic Union FTA. Both nations aim to boost connectivity and cooperation in transport, energy, and other sectors, targeting $100 billion in trade by 2030.

title: Chandigarh teacher death: 2 postmortems, 2 different results. Third to clear doubts
content: Conflicting postmortem reports and police records raise serious questions in the death of a 19-year-old teacher in Bhiwani. The initial postmortem indicated a torn salwar, signs of struggle, and a possible sexual assault before her throat was slit. However, police later cited a second autopsy suggesting pesticide poisoning and animal interference, dismissing the earlier findings.

title: From runs to riches: Gill's a smash hit with brands; value appreciates by 30%-40%
content: A Gen Z with much of his career ahead of him, Gill has all the chops a brand looks for. "Gill's brand value has appreciated by 30%-40% post the India-England series. His brand fees will increase anywhere in the range of 25%-50% depending on the kind of brand approaching him," Neeraj Jha, senior sports analyst and commentator, told TOI.

title: Foxconn is no longer Apple's iPhone factory floor, it is now building …
content: Foxconn, known for iPhone production, is changing its business. The company is now focusing on artificial intelligence. It is building AI servers for cloud computing and generative AI. Demand for AI infrastructure is increasing. Foxconn is partnering with Nvidia, Supermicro, and Dell. This move positions Foxconn as a key player in enterprise hardware.

title: Microsoft workers occupy HQ: Protest Israel ties; biggest escalation yet
content: Microsoft employees protested at the company's headquarters in Redmond, demanding an end to its contracts with Israel. The group, "No Azure for Apartheid," renamed the plaza "Martyred Palestinian Children's Plaza" and erected memorials. They are urging Microsoft to divest from Israeli partnerships, alleging the Azure cloud platform aids the Israeli military and contributes to civilian deaths in Gaza.

title: 'War 2' box office collection: Film misses the Rs 200 crore mark
content: Released on August 14th amidst high anticipation and a clash with 'Coolie', 'War 2' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr. NTR, initially saw a grand opening, fueled by Independence Day. However, mixed reviews led to a significant drop in collections from Saturday onwards, with a steep 73% fall on Monday.

title: Meet Epic CEO Faulkner, who donated 99% wealth of her fortune
content: Judy Faulkner, CEO of Epic Systems, has pledged to donate 99% of her $7.8 billion fortune to philanthropy, demonstrating a commitment to giving back. She fosters a unique corporate culture with themed office buildings and monthly meetings that blend business updates with grammar lessons.

title: 'If West criticises …': Russia slams Trump's 25% 'sanctions' on India
content: Russia has strongly condemned the US for pressuring India to halt Russian crude oil imports, deeming the tariffs 'unjustified' and 'unlawful.' Russian officials affirmed their commitment to uninterrupted oil supplies to India, highlighting a 'special mechanism'.

title: Removal of 'tainted' ministers: Oppn, Centre lock horns over 3 bills; key provisions
content: Amid opposition protests, Amit Shah introduced three significant Bills in the Lok Sabha. These Bills target the removal of Prime Minister, Union ministers, chief ministers, or state ministers if they are arrested for serious crimes and held in custody for 30 days. The proposed amendments cover the Constitution, Union Territories, and Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation Acts.

title: Roddick to critics: Respect Iga Swiatek after Cincinnati win
content: Andy Roddick swiftly defended Iga Swiatek after a social media user questioned her relevance following her Cincinnati Open victory against Jasmine Paolini. Roddick's one-word response, "Yes," on an Instagram post celebrating Swiatek's win, garnered praise from tennis fans. This support follows Roddick's earlier defense of Swiatek during her 2024 doping controversy, highlighting his consistent admiration for the Polish star's talent.

title: Gretzky legacy challenged amid Trump’s Canada trade war claims
content: Brantford, Ontario, Wayne Gretzky's hometown, faces economic challenges due to U.S. tariffs on Canadian goods. Local businesses, like Roustan Hockey, grapple with new trade restrictions, potentially impacting production and employment. While the tariffs stir controversy around Gretzky's ties to Trump, Brantford residents show resilience by supporting local products amidst economic uncertainty.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce plan marriage and kids as romance grows stronger
content: Sources reveal Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship is deepening, with marriage and children on their minds. The couple, reportedly feeling secure and loved, believe they've found their life partners. As Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift prepares for her album launch, their bond strengthens during quiet moments, solidifying their desire for a future together.

title: Taylor Swift’s emotional moment: 'The way her face changed'
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's affectionate bond continues to captivate fans, highlighted by a resurfaced Super Bowl moment where Kelce embraced Swift after his team's victory. Their recent appearance on the 'New Heights' podcast further showcased their love, with Swift announcing her new album, set to release on October 3rd, 2025.

title: Google Pixel 10 series launched: Price, specifications and more
content: Google has officially launched its Pixel 10 series, including the Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, Pixel 10 Pro XL, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold, along with the Pixel Watch 4 and Pixel Buds 2a. The Pixel 10 series features a triple camera system across all models and is powered by the Google Tensor G5 SoC.

title: Savannah James on teen pregnancy: LeBron James’ promise changed their lives
content: LeBron and Savannah James faced unexpected challenges with a teenage pregnancy. Savannah was scared about the future, but LeBron reassured her they would manage together. His draft to the Cleveland Cavaliers proved pivotal, providing stability and opportunity as they built their family, eventually marrying in 2013 and raising three children.

title: Hailee Steinfeld and DK Metcalf: Josh Allen’s wife shines in Hollywood
content: Fresh off her marriage to Josh Allen and the success of "Sinners," Hailee Steinfeld is set to star in Doug Liman's new thriller, "Asteroid," alongside NFL star DK Metcalf. The film, about strangers seeking wealth on an asteroid, also features Freida Pinto and Ron Perlman. Allen has publicly supported Steinfeld, even praising her acting in "Sinners.

title: IND vs PAK | 'Is the BCCI above national interest?': Letter to sports minister reignites debate
content: Aaditya Thackeray has penned a letter to the union sports minister, questioning BCCI's decision to play against Pakistan in the Asia Cup, citing national interest concerns. He highlighted past Pakistan-based terrorist attacks in India and questioned if BCCI prioritises financial gains over the sacrifices of soldiers and victims. The Asia Cup, featuring India-Pakistan matches, is scheduled in Dubai.

title: Delhi CM attacked: AAP rejects BJP's 'fake' photo of attacker
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) refuted Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) claim. BJP linked Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's attacker to AAP. AAP alleged video editing and fake photos. BJP MLA Harish Khurana shared a photo. The photo claimed attacker Sakaria Rajeshbhai Khimjibhai was with AAP's Gopal Italia. Italia denied the claim and threatened legal action.

title: 'Misplaced': India rejects Yunus govt's 'anti-B'desh activities' claim; calls for fair polls
content: India has dismissed Bangladesh's interim government's concerns about anti-Bangladesh activities originating from Indian soil, asserting its policy against allowing political actions targeting other nations. The MEA spokesperson emphasised India's expectation for free and fair elections in Bangladesh. This response follows Bangladesh's army chief's offer to support the interim government in ensuring neutral elections amid shifts in the political landscape.

title: Colon cancer on the rise among youngsters: 5 warning symptoms that should not be ignored
content: Colon cancer, a leading cause of cancer-related deaths, is increasingly affecting younger individuals. Those born in 1990 face twice the risk compared to those born in 1950. Changes in bowel habits, rectal bleeding, abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, and persistent fatigue are crucial warning signs. Early diagnosis and awareness are vital for improved treatment outcomes and survival.

title: IND vs PAK | When Pakistan pulled out: Asia Cup's turbulent past back in spotlight before UAE 2025
content: The 2025 Asia Cup, amidst geopolitical tensions, will be held in the UAE from September 9-28. India and Pakistan have announced their squads, but past withdrawals due to political strife cast a shadow. Pakistan pulled out in 1990-91, and India in 1986. This year, India is in Group A with Pakistan, UAE, and Oman.

title: WHO says removing sugar from diet can save 2.5 billion people from this disease
content: The World Health Organization warns about rising tooth decay. It links this to high sugar consumption. Over 2.5 billion people suffer from dental caries. WHO advises limiting free sugar intake. This includes sugars in processed foods and juices. Reducing sugar, brushing, and dental check-ups are key. Public health policies can also help. These include taxing sugary drinks and educating families.

title: India's captaincy debate | After Rohit, Iyer tipped as ODI skipper over Gill — 'He has ...'
content: While Shubman Gill is being groomed as a future leader, Ambati Rayudu believes Shreyas Iyer should be India's next ODI captain. Rayudu cites Iyer's calmness and success leading KKR to an IPL title, along with his ability to guide underdog teams. Iyer's consistent ODI performance, including a strong Champions Trophy and World Cup, further strengthens Rayudu's argument.

title: Indian student arrivals to US dips: Here’s how it could cost American students
content: Indian student visa arrivals to the US crashed by 46% in July 2025, triggering major financial alarm across American universities. A combination of visa freezes, heightened digital scrutiny, and immigration fears has led to a sharp drop in international enrolment. As Indian and Chinese students vanish, institutions face a projected $7 billion loss and 60,000 job cuts. The fallout threatens tuition subsidies, course offerings, and scholarships—placing the burden squarely on domestic students.

title: Asia Cup | 'Open your mouth carefully': Bumrah's critics lambasted
content: Mohammed Kaif has strongly supported Jasprit Bumrah's T20I return, dismissing fitness concerns raised during the England Test series. Kaif highlighted Bumrah's match-winning ability across formats and suggested white-ball cricket suits him better due to a manageable workload. He also expressed disappointment over Mohammed Siraj's Asia Cup exclusion, praising his form and wicket-taking ability.

title: 'Nation remembers': Shah slams oppn's uproar over new bills; cites Indira-era amendment
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticized the opposition for opposing bills aimed at removing ministers facing serious criminal charges. Shah highlighted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's commitment to fighting political corruption. He mentioned the introduction of a constitutional amendment to ensure ministers cannot govern from jail. The bills have been referred to a Joint Committee of Parliament.

title: 'I was in shock': Delhi CM Rekha Gupta's first reaction after attack
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta was attacked during a public hearing. She addressed the incident on X, vowing to continue serving the public. The accused, Sakariya Rajeshbhai Khimjibhai, has been arrested. He has a criminal record. Police are investigating the incident as a planned conspiracy. Security measures for CM Gupta may be reviewed.

title: Close call: Guwahati-Kolkata flight suffers mid-air technical glitch
content: An Alliance Air flight 9I756, en route from Guwahati to Kolkata, made an emergency return to Guwahati Airport due to a mid-air technical issue. The aircraft landed safely, and all passengers were safely deboarded. Airport authorities declared a full emergency, which was later withdrawn after the safe landing.

title: 'Going back to medieval times': Rahul slams new bills tabled in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the Centre's new bills proposing the removal of elected officials facing serious criminal charges, likening it to medieval times. He questioned the sudden resignation and silence of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar. Gandhi also voiced support for INDIA bloc’s Vice-Presidential candidate, Sudershan Reddy, expressing confidence in his strong campaign.

title: Maharashtra poll row: FIR against psephologist Sanjay Kumar; accused of 'spreading false info'
content: Sanjay Kumar, a psephologist with Lokniti-CSDS, faces legal trouble in Nagpur, Maharashtra, after an FIR was filed against him for allegedly spreading false information related to the assembly elections. The complaint cites multiple sections of the BNS following controversial social media posts.

title: 'I've settled six wars': Trump calls Netanyahu 'war hero'; says he is one too
content: Donald Trump praised Benjamin Netanyahu for ordering strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Trump called Netanyahu a war hero. He also suggested he deserved the same title. These comments followed Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. The US also deployed bombs against Iran's Fordo facility. Trump claimed to have eased tensions in several global conflicts.

title: Pro-American ideologies pre-requisite for visa, green card? What US agency said
content: Amidst growing concerns, the Trump administration's social media vetting and 'America First' policy are sparking division. Oklahoma plans to screen teachers from liberal states for 'woke' views. Trump criticized museums, including the Smithsonian and the National Museum of African American History and Culture, for focusing on negativity and slavery.

title: Indian cricket | 'When he steps away ...': Ex-batter predicts Rohit's retirement & successor
content: Mohammad Kaif has endorsed Shubman Gill as Rohit Sharma's successor in ODIs, anticipating Rohit's retirement after the 2027 World Cup. Kaif highlighted Gill's impressive run-scoring record and leadership qualities, noting his Test captaincy and T20I vice-captaincy. Gill's maturity and form, particularly during the England series, have solidified his position as a future leader, according to chief selector Ajit Agarkar.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: Has Sachin’s son shared anything on Instagram?
content: Arjun Tendulkar is reportedly engaged to Saaniya Chandok, though the Tendulkar family has not officially confirmed the news. The intimate ceremony was family-oriented, connecting the Tendulkar and Chandok families. Arjun, who plays for Mumbai Indians and represents Goa in domestic cricket, balances his personal milestone with his developing cricketing career.

title: Dignity and self-respect is more important than economic development: R. Adhiyaman, Aathi Thamizhar Peravai
content: Mr. Adhiyaman said the disagreement has laid bare difference between the Communist and the Periyarist point of views in the issue of conservancy workers’ protests and their demands.

title: Tripura Minister unveils bust of M.S. Swaminathan in Agartala
content: The late geneticist played a vital role in transforming the country from a food-deficient nation to one of self-sufficiency, Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Minister Ratan Lal Nath said

title: ‘Stree Shakti’ is a responsibility, not a burden, says Transport Minister Ramprasad
content: 750 new electric buses will be added to the APSRTC fleet soon, he says, adding that there is also a proposal to covert Palle Velugu buses into AC services in the next two years

title: One lakh individuals found ineligible so far under reverification of Sadaram disability certificates, says Minister Kolusu Parthasarathy
content: The drive is solely aimed at eliminating those fraudulently availing of pensions under NTR Bharosa scheme, he says; those wrongly declared ineligible can still appeal to the local authorities for reconsideration, he adds

title: Naidu sets target of building 10 lakh houses March 2026
content: Announcing that 3 lakh families will perform house-warming ceremony next month, the Chief Minister calls for a 15-day Statewide survey to identify homeless families and prepare a beneficiary list

title: Congress unions seek benefits for MGNREGS workers
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan, who inaugurated the protest, demanded that the government increase the number of working days to a minimum of 200 per year

title: Bangladesh’s accusations are misplaced, says Centre
content: Awami League’s activities  in India “may trigger public sentiment”, says interim government of Bangladesh

title: Panel to discuss the potential for integrated townships in Coimbatore on August 22
content: As per the 2011, Census, the rate of urbanisation in Tamil Nadu was 48.45% and according to latest projections, the rate of urbanisation in Tamil Nadu has reached 63% in 2021

title: Russia welcomes Wang Yi’s visit and the positive turn in India-China ties
content: The senior Russian diplomat described the energy ties between India and Russia as having remained unaffected by tariffs and sanctions from the U.S. and the EU

title: A historic move, but still unequal
content: Internal reservation matrix cleared by the Karnataka cabinet is a step forward, but the most backward communities within SC population have not got what they had hoped for

title: Ranchi school students accuse teacher of sexual harassment
content: Ranchi Deputy Commissioner Manjunath Bhajantri orders probe into the incident; teacher is absconding after reports of the complaint went viral on social media

title: ED arrests banned Maoist outfit’s supremo Dinesh Gope in money laundering case
content: He ran an extensive extortion racket and later laundered the collected money through a complex network of shell companies and firms, says the agency

title: Congress, RJD preparing ground to justify their defeat in the upcoming Assembly election: Bihar Minister Sanjay Saraogi
content: Opposition is in panic because infiltrators’ names are being removed by Election Commission, says Sanjay Saraogi

title: Hyderabad gamers hail Online Gaming Bill as boost for esports, curb on addiction
content: Hyderabad’s esports and gaming community welcome the Bill for shifting the conversation away from gambling-like activities

title: Brazil Police Find Evidence Bolsonaro Considered Argentina Asylum Request
content: Brazilian federal police found a letter directed to Argentine President Javier Milei in which former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro requested political asylum, a Supreme Court document showed on Wednesday.

title: "Draconian Act": Congress Slams Centre Over Constitution Amendment Bill
content: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Wednesday criticised the 130th Constitution Amendment Bill that sought to allow the removal of the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and ministers if they were held on serious criminal charges.

title: Gaza Conquest Plan Shows Israel's "Blatant Disregard" For Mediation: Hamas
content: Palestinian militant group Hamas said Wednesday that Israeli military plans to conquer Gaza City showed its "blatant disregard" for efforts to broker a ceasefire and hostage release deal in the nearly two-year conflict.

title: 6 Policemen Arrested For Constable's Custodial Torture In Jammu And Kashmir
content: The CBI on Wednesday arrested eight police personnel, including at least two officers, in connection with the alleged custodial torture of a cop, following orders from the Supreme Court last month, officials said here on Wednesday.

title: Nikki Haley Urges Trump To Treat India As "Prized Free, Democratic" Partner
content: Former US Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley, in an opinion piece on Newsweek, emphasised the need to treat India as a "prized free and democratic partner" to counter China.

title: Alliance Air Guwahati-Kolkata Flight Lands Safely After Tech Glitch
content: Alliance Air flight 9I756, operating on the Guwahati-Kolkata route, encountered a technical issue mid-air on Wednesday, resulting in the landing of the aircraft in Guwahati.

title: FBI Warns Of Russian Hacks Targeting US Critical Infrastructure
content: Russian hackers exploited a flaw in outdated Cisco software to target thousands of critical infrastructure networking devices over the past year, according to the FBI and Cisco.

title: On India-Russia Ties, S Jaishankar's "Doing More, Doing Differently" Mantra
content: India and Russia should come out with a creative and innovative approach to confront complex geopolitical challenges, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Wednesday amid increasing strains in New Delhi's ties with Washington.

title: Limit Exceeded: Congress After BJP Inducts 3 More Ministers In Chhattisgarh
content: The political atmosphere in Chhattisgarh has heated up following the expansion of the Vishnudev Sai-led BJP cabinet.

title: On 34th Manipuri Language Day, A Renewed Call For Classical Status
content: The 34th Manipuri Language Day Celebration in commemoration of the inclusion of the Manipuri language in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution was held on Wednesday.

title: Russia Struck Gas Station In Odesa, Says Zelensky
content: Russia struck a gas distribution station in the southern Ukrainian region of Odesa on Wednesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said, adding this showed the need to put economic pressure on Russia amid current US efforts to end the war.

title: Mandatory Muzzles For Pet Dogs In Public: Chennai Civic Body Warns Owners
content: Pet dogs in Chennai cannot be taken into public places without a muzzle, leash, and collar, the Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) has warned, as the city witnesses rising cases of dog bites and fatal attacks.

title: Man Travels 100 Km To Meet Girl, Gets Tied Up, Beaten For 13 Hours
content: A man from Madhya Pradesh who travelled 100 km to meet a girl he had befriended on Facebook was tied up by her family and beaten for 13 hours, police said on Wednesday.

title: Russia Says Security Discussions Without Moscow Are "Road To Nowhere"
content: Russia said on Wednesday that attempts to resolve security issues relating to Ukraine without the participation of Moscow were a "road to nowhere".

title: Explained: How Europe Tried To Speak Trump
content: A careful selection of cast and roles and a clear strategy to avoid deadlocks. European leaders' charm offensive on Donald Trump to foster Ukraine's cause this week was hastily arranged but followed a scripted plan, say European sources.

title: US Sanctions More ICC Judges, Citing Tribunal's Actions Against Israel
content: The United States on Wednesday imposed sanctions on four more International Criminal Court judges or prosecutors, including those from allies France and Canada, in a new effort to hobble the tribunal, particularly over actions against Israel.

title: 113-Year-Old Swedish Church Arrives At New Home After 2-day journey
content: A landmark Swedish church arrived Wednesday at its new home after a two-day move across the Arctic town of Kiruna, in a move to allow Europe's largest underground mine to expand.

title: "Untenable": Centre As Nepal Objects To India-China Trade Through Lipulekh
content: India on Wednesday rejected Nepal's opposition to the resumption of border trade with China through the Lipulekh Pass, calling Kathmandu's territorial claims "unjustified, untenable, and not supported by historical facts."

title: Record Surge In Mosquito-Borne Diseases In Europe, Says Health Agency
content: Europe has registered a record number of outbreaks of mosquito-borne illnesses such as chikungunya and West Nile virus this year, the EU health agency said Wednesday, saying climate change was contributing to a "new normal".

title: Trump Raises Pressure, Calls For Federal Reserve Governor To Resign
content: US President Donald Trump called Wednesday for Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook to step down, expanding pressure on the central bank after recent criticism of Fed Chair Jerome Powell for not lowering interest rates sooner.

title: India’s democracy is failing the migrant citizen
content: A migrant’s dual belonging, which is economic participation in a host State and political identity in his home State, is being demonised by the state

title: Not much Onam cheer for independent traditional weavers of Balaramapuram
content: Many of the elderly weavers working on contract in Thiruvananthapuram’s handloom hub chose weaving as their vocation at a very young age. For some, it was a glamorous job then. Some started at a daily wage of ₹3.5, and decades later, despite mounting inflation, the remuneration has touched only ₹250.

title: ‘Lady don’ Aruna sent to 14-day remand
content: She was arrested near Addanki and shifted to Kovur police station on Wednesday, following which she was produced in a court based on an extortion complaint filed by her house owner

title: At 21.89 lakh, EPFO records highest net addition in June
content: EPFO enrolled around 10.62 lakh new subscribers in June, representing a 12.68% increase over May and a growth of 3.61% compared to June 2024, the government said

title: Land acquisition for fencing 148 km of West Bengal-Bangladesh border yet to start
content: The Home Ministry told the Rajya Sabha that land acquisition payment had been made for 181.635 km but the land was yet to be handed over by the State; 1647.6 km out of 2216.7 km has been covered by fencing

title: Abysmal representation of students from marginalised classes in private higher education institutions: Parliament panel
content: Commenting on the report, the Congress says the Centre should bring a new law to allow 15% reservation for SCs, 7.5% for STs and 27% for OBCs in private higher educational institutes

title: Heavy flood threat in Godavari, Krishna rivers: Disaster Management Authority issues alert
content: Krishna river at Prakasam Barrage records an inflow and outflow of 4.67 lakh cusec, with the first flood warning remaining in place; SDRF teams have been deployed in vulnerable districts to assist with emergency operations

title: PM Modi to open six-lane bridge in Bihar
content: The 1.86-km Aunta-Simaria project will link Mokama in Patna district with Begusarai, thus linking north and south Bihar

title: Bill for crowd control that prescribes jail term and hefty fine for violators tabled
content: Offences under the proposed legislation are cognisable, non-bailable and triable by first class judicial magistrate

title: CM announces permanent SC Commission to review categorisation periodically
content: Opposition protests over not being allowed to seek clarification over the CM’s statement on the issue in both Houses

title: In Moscow, Jaishankar flags challenges that tariffs pose to India-Russia trade
content: Mr. Jaishankar also raised the issue of trade imbalance in India-Russia trade that has expanded in the past few years

title: Discontent brewing over move to turn Marine Drive  into a street vending zone
content: Kochi Corporation completes demarcation of areas for street vending carts on around 75% of the proposed vending zone along eastern side of Shanmugham Road, including Marine Drive

title: Uttarakhand Assembly clears amendments to UCC and anti-conversion Bills, new minority education law
content: The five-day Assembly session, which started on August 19, ended sine die within two days, amid protests by the Opposition leaders who demanded a debate on disaster management issues and law and order in the State under Rule 310

title: Trinamool leader sues R.G. Kar victim’s father over allegations of ‘settlement’ with CBI
content: The father of the deceased doctor had alleged Kunal Ghosh “made a settlement” with the CBI to “cover up” the investigation into the R.G. Kar rape and murder case

title: Manipur violence was not spontaneous, but planned, ethnically targeted and facilitated by state failures: report
content: Tribunal says systematic hate campaign through social media, and statements made by politicians led to escalation of feelings of mistrust and enmity between warring communities

title: India, Vietnam Coast Guards to collaborate on tackling maritime crime, search and rescue, marine pollution
content: High-level meeting in Hanoi co-chaired by the Coast Guard’s Additional Director General Anand Prakash Badola and Vietnamese Coast Guard Vice Commandant Major General Vu Trung Kien

title: Five of family die after electrocution in Jalgaon; teen killed by fallen live wire in Mumbai
content: According to police, the family accidentally touched an electrified wire fence installed around the farmland, owned by Bandu Yuvraj Patil, to protect crops from wild animals

title: Bill introduced by Amit Shah is a conspiracy to destabilise non-BJP governments: Dipankar Bhattacharya
content: CPI(M-L) leader also said that the Bill is the death knell for India’s constitutional federal system and parliamentary democracy. He appealed to citizens to strongly oppose the Bill.

title: Nine students of Central University of Kerala in a spot over varsity’s stand on FYUGP
content: University disinclined to go ahead with transition of 2022-2025 batch of BA International Relations course to FYUGP

title: High Court orders ₹25,000 payout for students who were given food eaten by a dog
content: The court took suo motu cognizance of the July 28 incident; compensation has to be paid within one month according to the order dated August 17

title: Damage-control focus of draft policy aimed to mitigate human-animal conflict
content: It envisions measures to bring down the loss of lives, property and agriculture. The proposal for a birth-control programme to control the population of bonnet macaques in populated areas assumes significance. The policy also stresses the need to mobilise resources to reduce human-wildlife conflicts by amending laws

title: West Bengal government hands over land for construction of border fence to BSF
content: Home Minister Amit Shah told the Lok Sabha in April that nearly 450 km of the border with Bangladesh has not been fenced yet due to the Trinamool Congress’s politics of appeasement

title: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi, wife pledge to donate organs after death
content: The couple, who were the chief guests at the event, joined senior dignitaries of the Armed Forces in making the pledge

title: Real Money Games firms quietly assess Bill banning their industry; video game firms welcome move
content: The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025 poses an existential threat to the pay-to-win space, say RMG firms; video game firms have complained about being confused with RMG, and welcomed the Bill.

title: Bengaluru Urban among top districts with high PM2.5 emissions from diesel generator sets
content: ‘DG sets, used for power backup across residential, commercial, and industrial sectors, are prominent hyperlocal sources of air and noise pollution throughout India.’

title: Passenger surge on Bengaluru metro’s Yellow Line: BMRCL installs safety railings at R.V. Road interchange station
content: After Following Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Interchange (Majestic), RV Road has now become the second station in the city to be fitted with such railings.

title: Bring digital data of all types of lands, including forests, under single geospatial platform for effective monitoring: Karnataka High Court
content: HC directed the setting up of a portal and a mobile app for public to get a comprehensive colour-coded reports on land-use classification, ownership history etc.

title: Bills to oust arrested PM, CMs: Committed to restoring moral standards in politics, says Amit Shah
content: “While Prime Minister Modi introduced a constitutional amendment to bring himself into the ambit of law, Congress-led Opposition opposed the bills to remain above the law and run governments from jail,” the Home Minister says

title: ‘Silicon Valley of solar’: Global solar alliance plans to establish research hub in India
content: 17 centres of excellence in as many countries will provide testing, lab training, and a ‘startup ecosystem’, the Director General of the alliance said

title: Rain takes break in State till August 27
content: First flood warning, however, will remain in place at Prakasam Barrage on Krishna river on Thursday; State Disaster Response Force teams have been stationed in low-lying areas

title: U.P.’s Jalalabad to get a new name, it’s Parashurampuri
content: The State government had told the Centre that Jalalabad is known as the birthplace of Parashuram, the saint, and houses an ancient temple dedicated to him

title: Report: Bullet fired into Reid's office in May '24
content: A bullet penetrated the glass in the practice-facility office of Andy Reid while the Chiefs coach was working alone in it last year, The Kansas City Star reported Wednesday night.

title: Cowboys coach expects to have Parsons in opener
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer is confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles.

title: Saints acquire WR Vele, send picks to Broncos
content: The Saints added to their receiver room ahead of the regular-season opener Wednesday, acquiring Devaughn Vele in a trade with the Broncos, who received two future draft picks in return.

title: WR Robinson suspended 3 games, per Shanahan
content: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Wednesday on San Francisco's KNBR radio that wide receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended three games stemming from a misdemeanor DUI charge.

title: Sources: Jets land Phillips in 2nd DT trade of day
content: The Jets acquired Harrison Phillips from Minnesota, sources told ESPN, their second trade of the day for a defensive tackle after they added Jowon Briggs from the Browns.

title: Fever's Clark also has bone bruise, source says
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, already out with a groin issue, suffered a bone bruise on her left ankle during a workout earlier this month, a source told ESPN, confirming a Fieldhouse Files report.

title: Injured Messi out of Miami's Leagues Cup QF
content: Lionel Messi is out of Inter Miami's Leagues Cup quarterfinal against Tigres UANL on Wednesday night due to an ongoing "minor" muscle injury.

title: Arkansas OK's field rushing -- after 3-minute delay
content: Arkansas will allow football fans to rush the field following big wins, but only after a delay so the Razorbacks can avoid hefty fines.

title: 👕 A history of soccer's most iconic jerseys
content: How did soccer's most storied clubs become synonymous with something as simple as a color? ESPN relives the kit histories of football's biggest teams.

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates’ early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
